citations.narrative:
A cable is hanging down into one enclosure that needs to be secured for the safety of the dogs. An enclosure adjacent to
this one has chain link that is no longer secured at the base of the enclosure and is protruding into the enclosure. These
two items need to be addressed to keep the enclosures in good repair and for the safety of the dogs.

Several of the support beams for the outdoor enclosures are showing signs of rust where the doors are connected to the
concrete and a few of the sections are rusted through creating sharp edges and impacting the structural integrity of the
frame. One metal support bar along the far enclosure is rusted out underneath the bar creating a sharp edged area 12
inches long. Another metal beam coming down vertically is rusted through near the ground creating a gap with sharp
edges in the metal. These sections of the primary enclosures must be addressed to keep the enclosures in good repair
and for the safety of the dogs.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within (2) more inspection(s) or by July 5, 2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.1(a) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
A cable is hanging down into one enclosure that needs to be secured for the safety of the dogs. An enclosure adjacent to 
this one has chain link that is no longer secured at the base of the enclosure and is protruding into the enclosure. These 
two items need to be addressed to keep the enclosures in good repair and for the safety of the dogs. 
3.1(c)(1)(i) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
Several of the support beams for the outdoor enclosures are showing signs of rust where the doors are connected to the 
concrete and a few of the sections are rusted through creating sharp edges and impacting the structural integrity of the 
frame. One metal support bar along the far enclosure is rusted out underneath the bar creating a sharp edged area 12 
inches long. Another metal beam coming down vertically is rusted through near the ground creating a gap with sharp 
edges in the metal.   These sections of the primary enclosures must be addressed to keep the enclosures in good repair 
and for the safety of the dogs. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant.

All items must be in compliance within (2) more inspection(s) or by July 5, 2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
